intro: Salpiglossis linearis, commonly known as the "Blushing Lady" or "Lipstick Plant," is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Phrymaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with linear, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by hummingbirds due to their shape and nectar-rich structure. Salpiglossis linearis is popular among gardeners for its vibrant blooms and ease of cultivation.
